Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the law requiring students to plant trees has not been approved by the upper house or signed by the president, which is required for legislation to become law.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the law by stating that it could result in 175 million new trees each year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on misleading articles that have not been verified by the proper legislative process.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the passage of the law will be strictly implemented by schools and universities.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the law has not yet been fully approved and implemented.
